pullRequest.body:
Prove that integrals are invariant when functions are changed along a discrete set.

This material is used in [Project VD](https://github.com/kebekus/ProjectVD), which aims to formalize Value Distribution Theory for meromorphic functions on the complex plane.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ CircleIntegrable.congr_of_codiscreteWithin`
`+ IntervalIntegrable.congr_codiscreteWithin`
`+ ae_restrict_le_codiscreteWithin`
`+ analyticOnNhd_circleMap`
`+ circleIntegrable_congr_of_codiscreteWithin`
`+ circleIntegral_congr_codiscreteWithin`
`+ circleMap_preimage_codiscrete`
`+ contDiff_circleMap`
`+ discreteTopology_of_codiscreteWithin`
`+ integral_congr_ae_restrict`
`+ integral_congr_codiscreteWithin`
`+ intervalIntegrable_congr_codiscreteWithin`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
@sgouezel Thanks, as always. I implemented all your suggestions.
almost everywhere what? Zero, or everything? Could you clarify the sentence, maybe?
Reformulated for clarity. It seems that writing docstrings is not my strong point at all. Maybe I should have an AI do that.
ditto
ditto

```suggestion
    {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X]
```
In general, you should always use `Type*`. But isn't there a topological space in scope that you could use, instead of declaring a new one?
You are right. Fixed by using a topological space in scope.

```suggestion
    (h : s  Filter.codiscreteWithin U) :
```

```suggestion
    DiscreteTopology ((s  U) : Set X) := by
```
Theorem statements are indented by 4 spaces.

```suggestion
theorem ae_restrict_le_codiscreteWithin
```

```suggestion
    { : Type*} [MeasurableSpace ] [TopologicalSpace ] [SecondCountableTopology ]
```
When you use `[MeasureSpace]`, you're fixing a measure on the space (the `volume`), which is not what you want to do here.

```suggestion
```
Not needed, I think.
You are right. Delted line as suggested.

Could you also add
```lean
theorem contDiff_circleMap (c : ) (R : ) {n : WithTop } :
    ContDiff  n (circleMap c R) :=
  (analyticOnNhd_circleMap c R).contDiff
```
after this one, and remove the TODO about this a few lines above?
Implemented.
All the other statements with the same flavor have `c` and `r` explicit, so could you do the same?
Implemented.

```suggestion
    map (circleMap c R) (codiscrete )  codiscreteWithin (Metric.sphere c |R|) := by
```
This one should rather be named `CircleIntegrable.congr_of_codiscreteWithin`, and then you should have another one named `circleIntegrable_congr_of_codiscreteWithin` which would be the iff version.
Implemented.
Could you move the assumption left of the colon?
Done.

instead of stating that just for the volume, can you state it for an arbitrary measure without atoms?

Also, could you give first an implication (named `IntervalIntegrable.congr_codiscreteWithin`) and then the iff version as you do? Note that the implication has a one-line proof, as 
```
theorem IntervalIntegrable.congr_codiscreteWithin {g :   E}
    (h : f =[codiscreteWithin ( a b)] g) 
    (hf : IntervalIntegrable f volume a b) : IntervalIntegrable g volume a b :=
  hf.congr (ae_of_restrVol_le_codiscreteWithin measurableSet_Ioc h)
```
Done.

pullRequest.title: feat: congruence theorems for interval/circle integrals
